title: Resources on book design and retail graphics
content:
Hi there.   
I am a student who would like to get into book design and retail graphics. If anyone has any good suggestions on books or websites which give good examples/introduction I would be very grateful.

 [‹ Free stuff](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615180944/http:/www.typophile.com/node/10248 "Go to previous forum topic") [Wanted: Great photos of New York lettering ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615180944/http:/www.typophile.com/node/10061 "Go to next forum topic")
author: newbie_chez

comments.content: There might be something [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615180944/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/73/73.html?1111652047), but besides just looking at lots of books and deciding how they made what look good and/or work well (which I fully intend to do someday, when I have time), there's always [amazon](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615180944/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/1840004215/qid=1112842914/sr=1-1/ref=sr_1_1/104-4121355-1284755?v=glance&s=books). Sorry I couldn't help more.

Maybe you'll like Jost Hochulis ideas on books typography, I do.   
   
 [http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0907259235/104-5588801-7179926](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615180944/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0907259235/104-5588801-7179926)   
   
Regards,   
ute

[The Well Made Book: Essays and Lectures](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615180944/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/097156874X/typophile-20) by Daniel Berkeley Updike   
   
 [Unjustified Texts: Perspectives on Typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615180944/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0907259170/typophile-20) by Robin Kinross

[Notes on Book Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615180944/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0300103476) by Derek Birdsall   
   
 [On Book Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615180944/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0300075707) by Richard Hendel   
   
 [The Design of Books](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615180944/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/081180304X) by Adrian Wilson and Sumner Stone   
   
 [The Form of the Book](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615180944/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0881790346) by your cranky ol' grandpa, Jan Tschichold   
   
(I'm still looking for those last two myself.)

Methods of Book Design, Hugh Williamson, Yale U Press. This is pretty good, but I just happened to glance up at it on my bookshelf; there are many others. Available at   
 [http://yalepress.yale.edu/yupbooks/Viewbook.asp?isbn=0300030355](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615180944/http:/yalepress.yale.edu/yupbooks/Viewbook.asp?isbn=0300030355)
